reviewText: Erwin Rommel was one of the most fascinating figures of the Nazi era, a brilliant field commander whose reputation for honour and chivalry is as famous as his achievements on the battlefield, and was profoundly at odds with the evil regime he served and eventually turned against.  Unfortunately, as is the case with most History Channel biographies, this runs only 45 minutes.  It certainly could have been and deserved to be much longer and more detailed.  You can probably find more extensive information and archival footage on YouTube.
